item.title: Week notes (2025-W47)
item.description:
• Meetings to re-align on the PG study.
  • Held another interview.
  • Re-organized some older codes, and began re-visiting older interviews.
  • Work on qc-viz has been slow.

  • Submitting a grant over the weekend / after hours.
  • Weekend after-hours work on presentations for side-projects.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W46)
item.description:
• Meetings and updates regarding the PG grant analysis
  • Bringing codes over to qc
  • Some more work on qc-viz, including a draft blog post
  • Worked on a grant for a side-project over the weekend

item.title: Week notes (2025-W45)
item.description:
• Got the ball rolling on the emails analysis
  • Progress update with David
  • Qualitative coding
  • Some work on qc-viz (slow debug mode, at my claude token limit)
  • Followed up with prospective interviewees
  • Participated in Global Health Night
  • Before- and after-hours work on side projects

item.title: Week notes (2025-W44)
item.description:
• Held a guest lecture for a colleague’s Digital Curation class.
  • Led a meeting ti align the emails analysis, and developed a solid initial strategy to get the ball rolling.
  • Invited additional interview participants.
  • Worked on qc-viz, which is now nearly complete.
  • Gave feedback for a friend’s job applications.
  • Postdoc gala.
  • Fall cleaning.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W43)
item.description:
• Finished transcribing the last interview and wrote reflexive memos about it too
  • Worked on qc-viz (the lua filter)
  • Developed the PG protocol
  • Progress on my guest lecture for a Digital Curation class next week
  • Side project stuff

item.title: Week notes (2025-W42)
item.description:
• Held another interview.
  • Worked on the PG protocol.
  • Started vibe-coding a better interface for visual exploration of codings.
  • Worked on my presentation for a guest lecture in a colleague’s class.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W41)
item.description:
• Completed another round of coding for an additional interview.

  • Scheduled two more interviews and began revising the interview guides.

  • Continued to think through the next phase of analysis, and met with David to discuss.

  • Continued to develop the project grant research protocol, specifically focusing on developing a taxonomy of the values applied during data cleaning.

  • Continued to think and play around with ways of visualizing the analysis by passing information from qc to quarto.

  • Briefly watched some of the presentations for a conference on Open Science in Canada put on at Concordia.

  • Revised proofs for a paper deriving from my dissertation.

  • Worked on the data-tech-poli-arch paper over the weekend.

  • Participated in the Montreal Anarchist Tech Convergence over the weekend.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W40)
item.description:
• Finished coding another interview
  • Worked on the protocol for the CIHR PG study
  • Got a rundown of the data cleaning processes for the CIHR PG study
  • Met with Chris Proctor for support on my qc workflows, and to discuss the software’s potential
  • Submitted a peer review

item.title: Week notes (2025-W39)
item.description:
Overall, a very productive week. Feels great to get back into the research after spending so much time in grant-land, and then suffering from a really terrible cold. It’s also the Jewish high holidays, which kinda scaffolds my work in a weirdly productive way.

I also received equipment that enables me to use both of my external displays, and settled on a combination digital and analog method for coding, so I’m finally getting into a more productive “zone”. I may write a blog post about that next week.

  • Finished re-coding an entire interview.

    • Hand-coded and then brought into the qc database.

  • Around halfway done hand-coding another interview.

  • Got a primer on the state of the data tables for the cleaned-up email correspondence data.

  • Initiated work on a protocol document for the CIHR Project Grant study.

  • Attended David’s seminar presentation.

  • Revised proofs from a paper deriving from my dissertation work.

  • Worked on a peer-review due this weekend.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W38)
item.description:
• Followed up with grant collaborators.
  • Revised proofs for an upcoming publication.
  • Revising older interviews.

I developed a major cold, which severely impacted by ability to do productive work. Hopefully it gets better sooner rather than later.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W37)
item.description:
• Submitted all my grant proposals.
  • Started taking stock of the data I’d collected during the summer.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W36)
item.description: • Grant-writing, nonstop.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W35)
item.description:
• Grant writing, and emails in support of grant writing.
  • Was partially out of commission this week due to a biking injury.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W34)
item.description:
• Mainly grant-writing and emails in support of grant-writing.
  • Participated in the Surveillance Lab discussion.
  • Participated in a grant-writing educational webinar.
  • Posted about the challenges of accessing and using scholarly metadata pertaining to monographs and grey literature (part of the BibVik project).
  • Mentally preparing for the start of the new semester next week.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W33)
item.description:
• Lots of grant-writing, mainly.
  • Also lots of emails in support of grant-writing.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W32)
item.description:
• Working on the code system.
  • Grant-writing.
  • Scheduling additional interviews.
  • Surveillance Lab meeting.
  • Grant-writing webinar.
  • Working on the ICF paper.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W31)
item.description:
This was a busy one, and looks like all of August will be packed too.

  • Much work on the project grant
    • Presented progress to the rest of the team
    • Started developing an entity-relationship diagram to arrive at more structured nomenclature
    • Signed up for a grant-writing webinar
    • Initiated parallel work on an NFRF exploration grant submission
  • Held another interview
  • Scheduled another interview
  • Significant progress made on the ICF paper
  • Progress on organizing the code system has been limited, I must admit

  • Hosted the SSLA meeting
  • Checked in regarding MSCA grant
  • Inquired about challenges I face for software I use (qc and grobid)
  • Initiated a TT job application
  • Touched on work for the data-tech-poli-arch workshop in December

item.title: Week notes (2025-W30)
item.description:
• Amalgamating and organizing codes.
  • Working on grant proposals.
  • Journal club discussion.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W29)
item.description:
• Finished open coding for the interviews I’ve done thus far.
  • Started re-arranging the codebook.
  • Wrote an intermittent report, which is basically a series of memos to keep me writing in a thematic way and to keep me on my toes as I code.
  • Worked on the CIHR project grant.

  • Submitted revisions for one paper from my dissertation.
  • Update the preprint for another paper with some more visual flair.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W28)
item.description:
• Coded interviews.
  • Held yet another interview.
  • Participated in Surveillance Lab discussion about AI and publishing.
  • Worked on a CIHR project grant.
  • Worked on the MSCA grant (great progress!).
  • Worked on the ICF/data governance paper (also great progress!).

Overall, a really busy week!
